text:
York Street, east from Pearl Street. Overhead is the Manhattan Bridge.
March 9, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

York Street, north side, west from Pearl to Fulton Streets, showing in the background in order the Brooklyn Bridge approach and the Fulton Street Elevated line. At the N.W. corner of Washington and York Streets is the Gair Building. At the right partially seen in order are the Robert Gair Co. and the A & P Products Co. building; and the Interstate corrugated Box Co. and the American Tea Co. building.

April 4, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

York Street (left) at the N.W. corner of Pearl Street. Over- is the approach to the Manhattan Bridge. In the background the 13 story building housing the Robert Gair Co. and the A. & P. Co.

April 4, 1938.

Sperr
